result.execSummary:
The defendant Miranda A. Grace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: STAYED as long as DE is in compliance w/the C.A.R.E. treatment recommendations

miscConds.notes: Defendant enroll in and succesfully complete drug addiction treatment through C.A.R.E. Program, including Vivitrol shots as recommended.  Provide DNA sample.  Any counseling deemed appropriate per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miranda A. Grace in custody and in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.  Atty Middleton is in agreement.  15CF271 - Atty Middleton waives her right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Middleton acknowledges rec. information in 15CF271/waives reading.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Poss. Heroin 961.41(3g)(am).  Court so amends.  Atty Middleton enters NC pleas to 15CF271 as amended and Cts 2 and 3 in 15CF326.   DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State notices the victim was noticed and provided a VIS but doesn't appear today.  Parties review the VIS from one of the dismissed/read-in cases.  Atty Middleton makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

15CF326
Ct 1:  Dismissed
Cts 2 and 3:  NC
Probation for 24 months on each count concurrent to each other and 15CF271
Conditions of probation:
Care Program treatment program including vivitrol shots
$443.00 x 2 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent
Counseling per agent

15CF271
Ct 1:  NC - ***amended to possession of heroin as a class I felony 961.41(3g)(am)***
Probation for 30 months concurrent to 15CF326
Conditions of probation:
Drug addiction counseling and programming thru Care Program including vivitrol shots
6 months jail STAYED as long as DE is in compliance w/probation conditions
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided
$100.00 to SCDTF
Counseling per agent
If successful on probation the matter may be expunged under 973.015***

Return date at 10-28-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Miranda A. Grace in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Miranda A. Grace in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Near resolution.  Need reset.  Return date scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Miranda A. Grace in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Hoege in Court.  State and Attorney Middleton ready to proceed.  State calls Officer Hoege, sworn & testifies.  State request court take judicial notice of the bond in this file.  Continues direct of Officer Hoege, Reedsburg Police Department.  Defendant identified by Officer Hoege.  Testifies as to new charges pending.  Attorney Middleton cross examines.  State request $1000.00 cash bond be forfeited and defendant be taken into custody.  Attorney Middleton object to any cash bond forfeiture at this time.  Defendant appears today and has continued contact.  Request bond remains and new charges play out in the normal course.  State cites case law and responds further.  Court cites 961.13.  Court addresses the bond conditions which were violated.  Court orders bond forfeited.  Defendant to be taken into custody.  Surety not present and makes no argument.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 08-07-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Miranda A. Grace appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is represented by Attorney Middleton through PD office.  State request $1000 cash bond w/ conditions.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  No warrants and ties to community.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx and use Rx. accordingly.  Absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
